title: Beijing embarrassed by mass youth unemployment
summary: Unemployment is at an all-time high among China's youth, despite numerous job shortages. With higher levels of education than previous generations, they are more reluctant to work in factories.

title: Israel-Palestinian peace: What is the two-state solution?
summary: Israel and Palestine as two independent states, coexisting side by side − this was the principle of the Oslo Accords, signed in 1993 by then-Israeli PM Yitzhak Rabin and Yasser Arafat, former chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization. But since the agreements' failure, some consider this solution unrealistic.

title: How Benjamin Netanyahu became the leader of the 'civilized world'
summary: The 'war on terror' Netanyahu has been preaching continuously for four decades is imposing its ideological muscle memory on Western democracies.

title: Mob storms Russian airport, looking for Jewish passengers from Israel
summary: An airport in Russia’s Muslim southern region closed after hundreds stormed the tarmac and climbed onto planes on the evening of Sunday, October 29, 2023. The governor of Dagestan promised that those responsible for the incident would be punished.

title: COP28: In Dubai, migrant workers toiled under extreme heat to get climate conference facilities ready in time
summary: According to an investigation by the British NGO FairSquare, the ban on working during the hottest hours of the day was not respected –  just a few months before the summit to fight global climate change.

title: Matthew Perry fans pay tribute at iconic NYC 'Friends' building
summary: After the death on Saturday, October 28, 2023, of the actor who played Chandler Bing in the hit sitcom, fans traveled to the building on the corner of Bedford Street and Grove Street, which served as the exterior shot of the characters' apartments throughout the show's 10 seasons.

title: Elon Musk, the disinformed disinformer
summary: In just one year, the Tesla and SpaceX boss has transformed Twitter into X, a social media network where fake news proliferates. But he himself is a victim of this ecosystem, with his naiveté and gullibility shining through.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: South Africa remains on top of the world after nerve-wracking final
summary: The Springboks triumphed over New Zealand 12-11 on Saturday. A victory by the slimmest of margins, it made Siya Kolisi's team the most successful in history.

title: Erdogan, the enduring reinterpreter of Turkish history
summary: The Turkish president, who celebrated the 100th anniversary of the Republic on October 29, is reviving sultans and strongmen, while relying on a dramatization of the national narrative. He aligns characters and events with his ideological vision in a neo-Ottoman-inspired bid for renaissance.

title: Macron plans to make abortion an 'irreversible' constitutional right in France
summary: In an online post on Sunday, the French president said, 'In 2024, the right of women to choose abortion will become irreversible.'

title: With the death of Matthew Perry, 'Friends' loses its Chandler Bing
summary: Deliberately funny and ironic about his own weaknesses, weakened by his addictions to alcohol and painkillers, the actor marked the cult series with his impeccable sense of comic timing. He died on October 28 at the age of 54.

title: Pope Francis attempts to instill a new culture in the Catholic Church
summary: At the end of the synod intended by the pontiff to be an assembly at the service of everyone, a report was drawn up which raises the possibility of ordaining women deacons.

title: Harry in his little navy polo shirt: Does anyone care?
summary: On October 22, Prince Harry attended the Formula 1 Grand Prix held on the Circuit of the Americas in Austin, Texas. It was an opportunity to see that, at 39, his highness is chasing his youth.

title: In French Polynesia, dog overpopulation is making residents' life miserable with bites, accidents and noise
summary: The dog population in French Polynesia is estimated at nearly 500,000, almost twice as many as the 280,000 human residents. Animal protection organizations are calling for mass sterilization campaigns for these often stray animals.

title: In Poland, after their surprise victory, the democrats prepare for a tense coalition with President Duda
summary: The future majority will have to re-establish the rule of law and the country's credibility on the European stage. To be enacted, all legislative initiatives, apart from the budget vote, require the signature of the president, a member of the ultra-conservative party.

title: Tyson Fury wins split decision against MMA fighter Ngannou
summary: Mixed martial arts fighter Francis Ngannou knocked Fury down in round three but the 35-year-old British fighter, though shaken, was able to continue. He remained undefeated at 34-0-1 with 24 knockouts.

title: Greece painfully rebuilds its economy after 15 years of depression
summary: On Friday, S&P upgraded Greece's rating. But while the economy has been cleaned up, it remains 20% below its 2008 level and the population is still very impoverished.

title: Israel warns that Gaza City is now 'a battlefield' after conducting intense bombardment over the past 24 hours
summary: No official death toll was given after Friday night's offensive that also knocked out all of Gaza's communication networks, but the level of bombardment was unprecedented since the start of the war on October 7. Le Monde followed events as they unfolded today.

title: Israel-Hamas war: At the Polishuk farm in Kfar Bilu, volunteers have replaced workers
summary: Thai fruit pickers are waiting to be repatriated; Palestinians are no longer welcome... All over the country, volunteers are making up for the lack of foreign workers and Israelis called upon by the army.

title: The scourge of drone deliveries to French prisons
summary: Criminal networks are increasingly using remote-controlled drones to deliver goods such as knives, cell phones and drugs to inmates. This practice is causing concern for French prison authorities.
